But I'm ready to go on behalf of live from here I'm resuming my journey across the country sharing the good stories of our fellow Americans
This week I traveled to Buffalo New York along Lake Erie were the sky was cloaked in a constant gray missed allowing for just occasional peaks of the colorful leaves
The forecasts was calling for the first snow fall of the year but for the good people of buffalo that's not even cause to wear a long sleeve shirt
When you live in Buffalo complaining about the weather is complaining about life itself
I was picked up at the airport by a woman named Charlie she's been driving for twenty two years in her cab was filled with stuffed animals they line the dashboard hung from the rear view mirror and among the was attached to the steering wheel
These are my co pilot she said some people have Jesus I have these guys she goes by Charlie because her father was hoping she'd be a boy I really think the name made me a bit of a tomboy when I was younger they don't say tomboy anymore now everybody is filled with gender fluids
I guess that was ahead of my time but anyway I'm all girl now and everyone still calls me Charlie
After growing up in Buffalo she went to college down in Arizona because they want it to go to the hottest place I could find but it turns out I'm not built for the desert seems more like a place for lizards
People who stay there too long start to look like us

I entered what looked like one of the older bars in the city covered in lights and years of signed coasters stuck to the walls to kind of place where it's always midnight the kind of place that so tired that even the ceiling seems to be hunched over at the end of the bar
The bartender was a big bear of a man named Chris he had a giant beard and big pause and he'd growled while he worked
He said that he's been in this bar for Thirty years and then he's been there so long he doesn't even smell they're famous buffalo wings any more people come in all the time and they say they smelled them all the way down the street but I don't smell as saying who knows maybe it's me they smell

Eagerly place my order there's something great about eating food that makes a city famous
In addition to whatever natural elements are involved the water the air the ingredients there's also a pride and love and as corny as it might sound the love the people add makes all the difference have you ever been away from home
